text: Charles H. Pitman (October 20, 1935 - February 13, 2020) was an American politician. He was lieutenant general in the United States Marine Corps. Pitman was Deputy Chief of Staff for Aviation.http://navymarineassociation.net/pdf/Official%20Biography%20for%20Charles%20H.%20Pitman.pdf He retired in 1990. He served during the Vietnam War and was awarded the Purple Heart. Pitman was born in Chicago, Illinois. Pitman died on February 13, 2020 from cancer, aged 84. ==References== * 40 years after sniper Mark Essex, Marine pilot is proud he helped stop the carnage Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Florida Category:American generals Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War Category:Military people from Chicago Category:United States Marine Corps personnel
